items.content_html:
See the final output: 

Today, I am analyzing existing research on water quality, evaluating model performances, comparing hybrid models with base models, and formulating an innovative solution for water quality anomaly detection.

Goal: By the end of the day, I will have a comprehensive understanding of water quality research, model performance comparisons, and a well-documented draft outlining an innovative solution for anomaly detection.

Hourly Research Plan:

From 8:00 to 9:00 AM, I set up my research by defining queries, gathering papers from Google Scholar, and organizing them in Zotero/Mendeley.

From 9:00 to 10:30 AM, I conduct a literature review, identify advancements, take notes, and summarize key concepts using ChatGPT and NotebookLM.

At 10:30 AM, I take a short break for midday prayer and hydration.

From 11:00 AM to 12:30 PM, I evaluate model performance, compare ML/DL techniques, and analyze their strengths and weaknesses.

At 12:30 PM, I take a lunch break.

From 1:30 to 3:00 PM, I compare hybrid and base models, identifying their effectiveness and challenges using AI tools.

At 3:00 PM, I take a short break for afternoon prayer.

From 3:30 to 5:00 PM, I brainstorm and draft an innovative solution for anomaly detection, outlining algorithms and challenges.

From 5:00 to 6:00 PM, I document research findings in Overleaf, focusing on the methodology section.

At 6:00 PM, I break for dinner and evening prayer.

From 7:00 to 9:00 PM, I refine the paper, finalize findings, format references in LaTeX, and review key sections.

From 9:00 to 10:00 PM, I reflect on progress, plan next steps, and complete night prayer.

From 10:00 to 11:00 PM, I proofread the document, ensure clarity, and prepare for the next session before resting.
